body:
@josevalim, I agree with you in the idea that we need have plugins for set defaults like uglifier-rails but I think is a good idea have a clear API for those plugins and allow to users to register their custom compressors without have to wait for a plugin or had to write their own plugin. Lets me explain a simple usage case:

There are some minimal CSS compressors like CSSMin by Ryan Grove that only has one file: https://gist.github.com/1106101

Using the proposed API I can save this compressor to lib/cssmin.rb in my app and register it easily without have to write a 'cssmin-rails' plugin:

```ruby
Sprockets::Railtie.register_css_compressor(:cssmin, CSSMin)
config.assets.css_compressor = :cssmin
```

Think that this is something like ActionView::Template::Handlers that has an API used by Haml, Slim, etc but also allows you register your custom handlers classes (or procs)
